alert.note: Alert for Middle Tanana Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 27 at 7:25AM AKDT until March 28 at 6:00AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow with periods of freezing rain. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 6 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. * WHERE...Middle Tanana Valley. * WHEN...Until 6 AM AKDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...There is a chance of freezing rain this morning, with freezing rain becoming likely this afternoon. Freezing rain will end late this evening. Snow is occuring north of Fairbanks, and is expected to spread south over Fairbanks this evening and continue into early Tuesday. The heaviest snow will be north of Fairbanks. Fairbanks and North Pole can expect about 2 inches of snow.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
